intro: Lapageria alba, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a striking plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It is a climbing plant that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and a woody stem, which help it climb and support its heavy blooms. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Lapageria alba is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
